data.title: If cleanliness matters, this is not the place for you.
data.text: The owner was very friendly and nice.  He let us stay as long as we wanted. Those are the positives.  We we first arrived the place looked nice enough.  Once entering, i changed my mind.  The room looked as if it hadn't been properly cleaned in years. Dust, bugs and filth everywhere. The ceilings had water stains and mold. My bedding had a long, jet black hair on the pillowcase.  Under the vanity was molded and damp.  We ran out of toilet tissue and had to get from another bathroom.  I looked for some water and opened the fridge and it had rotten food inside.  Needless to say, we didn't eat the breakfast served.  I got the creeps.  I will never return.  I heard it going to be closing soon anyways.

data.title: HORRIBLE Management/Ownership
data.text: The owner/manager is the rudest person I have ever encountered.  Don't waste your time or money on this place.  It's also right beside what appears to be college sorority houses on top of that.  The owner/manager was so rude and even YELLED at me.  Needless to say, I will NEVER stay here again nor would I recommend it to my worst enemy.  I hope the place gets shut down.

data.title: Amazing stay! Will come back.
data.text: Great B&B - perfect location, cute rooms, and Sonny is the best host! Everything is walking distance, and it's the best priced place in downtown for sure. This is the best place in the area that I've stayed. The breakfast casserole was delicious. I will come back for sure!

data.title: Bad managment
data.text:
Beautiful old house with lots of untapped potential. We stayed in the penthouse which is a gorgeous room with a spa tub. We didn't use the tub because it was filthy and I didn't want to clean while on vacation. The tiny shower in the room was full of what looked like bottles of shampoo purchased at the dollar store or left behind by other guests. To top it off the sink was missing a nozzle for the hot water and the shower nozzle was labelled incorrectly and I almost scalded myself. 

Our breakfast involved a trip down a rickety spiral staircase into a poorly lit and musty smelling dungeon. I asked Sonny if there was another means of getting to the kitchen as my boyfriend has a disability. He condescendingly told me old ladies could manage them but if we really wanted to we could walk down the driveway and enter through the back door of the kitchen. Breakfast included badly cooked eggs, generic yogurt, toast and an assortment of jelly jars that all looked as though they'd seen better, fresher days. The worse part of breakfast was the long, unwanted conversation with Sonny regarding the benefits of colloidal silver. (not making this up, he makes it and drinks it which he proved to us by spraying some in his mouth out of a filthy spray bottle...wth?) The snacks left out were off brand pre-packaged cookies and a bowl of rotting fruit. Maybe it was too dark down in the kitchen for him to see what he was putting out for his guests. We went out for breakfast our second day. Sonny did tell us he had friends at a local brewery so there were complimentary growlers in the kitchen and we could help ourselves. I went to the kitchen our second night to get some of the beer and was so disgusted by the mess in the refrigerator that I passed on the beer. 

When it was time to settle up Sonny asked for a higher payment amount than what had been quoted to us. Sadly we would not go back or recommend to other travelers which is a shame because this location has lots of potential. Hopefully someone else buys the place and makes this Inn what it could be.

data.title: Bad business practice!
data.text: We made a reservation at Maplehurst for the Architecture Open House weekend at the University of Tennessee for our high school aged son.  Maplehurst appears to be a small family-run business, and he asked me to call Friday night before 9 to let him know exactly when we would be arriving.  So at 8:30, I called, but to my surprise, he said I would need to find another place to stay.  He had a customer stay an extra night so he could not accommodate me.  We were near Asheville, NC, so we still had a little over two hours to get there.  However, we had to stop to make a reservation elsewhere.  This is bad business practice.  What is the point of a reservation?

data.title: Don’t expect your reservation to be what you reserved.
data.text:
Apparently Sonny has a habit of losing his records. So he asked us what we reserved. I told him we had reserved the River View Room - with a Queen Bed (it should have been $89 / night). He said someone trashed that room, but we would be lucky to get the Penthouse (for a discount rate of $110) - as he had other customers who he was going to call and tell that the rooms they booked were taken. Sonny said that some people decided to stay longer than anticipated and he did not want to ask them to leave. 

I rather had the impression that perhaps some were long term renters - who perhaps paid by the week or month. Who knows? I did not assume that he was being straight with us.

The bed was lumpy with a plastic sheet cover. The rug was rather dirty. My husband thought the couch stunk (I had a cold - I couldn’t smell much). Some things were okay, some needed work, replaced, cleaned. There was wifi in parts of the place - but not in the 'penthouse'.

I liked the variety of fruit at breakfast. The eggs were watery and tasteless.

data.title: Location, Location, Location
data.text: Second year at the Maplehurst Inn.  Tailgated with 28 people next door at the Methodist Church.  Sonny was the best.  He Let us barrow a couple folding chairs.  He is a great host.  15 minute walk to the stadium.  10 minute walk to see the VOL Navy.  We stayed in the Penthouse.  King size bed and sitting area.  Large bathroom.  Has deck with view of River and Neyland Stadium.  We will be back!

data.title: Everything was broken
data.text: The TV, bed, the blinds, and toilet all were broken, waters stains all over the ceiling. The bolts weren't even all of the way in the bed. When we arrived about 10 college students were on the porch next door drinking and partying very loudly. My husband who is 6" 2 didn't fit on the bed. His feet hung over the foot by at least a foot or more. Not to mention...we had our 2 yr old toddler with us who weighs in at 25 pounds and 7 oz...as she walked near the bed, the chest of drawers leaned forward. That was enough for us to leave. Please don't stay here with children it's potentially dangerous.  No staff anywhere to be found. This place is a joke. I will never stay here again and I will never recommend that anyone else does. This isn't the nicest part of town either. RUN!!!

data.title: Just like home
data.text:
I can't imagine having had stayed anywhere else. I felt more than comfortable and welcome. It was my first time traveling on my own so I was worried about how safe I would feel but I was never worried about it staying at the Maplehurst Inn. Sonny makes a great breakfast to your liking! He also gives great advice about where to go in town for sight seeing, shopping and food (all within walking distance).

The room had everything I needed and was well air conditioned!  Keep in mind it is an older building and there may be a few little spider webs but that was about it!

Knoxville is wonderful. I plan on moving there in the near future but until then I will be staying here whenever I visit!

data.title: 3 Good Things and 3 Not-so-good Things
data.text: With some TLC, this place could be a treasure.  For now I will say that the location is great - close to the river and shopping, dining etc.  The host - Sonny - answered his phone on the first ring every time I called him with a request and he is cheerful and helpful.  Some of the old furniture and decorations are fun to look at.   The mattress in our room was nice and firm and I slept very well.   While the place is indeed shabby and run-down - I don't mind that in an old B&B, but when the jacuzzi tub barely functions above a slow gurgle and the sink is literally falling apart - it's time to admit that the time has come for some updates.  Also, the dining room is down a steep flight of spiral steps and smells so old and moldly I could barely breathe the air.  I wanted to love this place and write off the poor reviews as whiners, but I think they might have a point. Here's hoping some updates are coming for the Maplehurst Inn very soon.

data.title: Shabby and run down
data.text:
This is just not a nice place to stay.  The location is conveniently close to the downtown area, but the rooms are poorly maintained and service is spotty at best.  Breakfast is mediocre, at best.

The host, Sonny, is helpful when you ask, but you gotta ask.  If you don't, beds don't get made, towels don't get changed, etc.

data.title: Outstanding Bed and Breakfast
data.text:
My Wife and I stayed in the Penthouse Suite at this bed and breakfast.
It has a wonderful view from the balcony of the Tennessee River and downtown Knoxville.
We were able to walk to many attractions and dinner. The Owner/Innkeeper took pride in
making sure we had a very pleasant stay.

Brenda and Mike, Atlanta, GA

data.title: friendly and welcoming
data.text: Sonny was friendly and welcoming and even cooked us a breakfast to order. This is a comfortable, down-to-earth place to stay in a great location. If you enjoy staying in a B&B where you have a chance to get to know the innkeeper, this is a good choice!

data.title: Somehow, this B&B was not as reserved
data.text: We reserved a room called the Penthouse. When we arrived in the evening, the Inn Keeper said he has misplaced his booking book and someone who had arrived earlier said she had the Penthouse, so he gave it to her. We were put in a room on the second floor with paint peeling from the ceiling, a window that looked like a ball had been thrown through it, then taped over with packer's plastic tape, a bathroom window that would not stay up, and too few towels. This was simply not up to the billing on its web site, and we left the next day to stay the remaining time in a hotel.

data.title: Thank you Sonny, sorry I am late.
data.text: You couldn't ask for a more comfortable stay, nor nicer people.  My husband and I stayed here on one of his work trips and Sonny really took care of us. I am sorry it took me a while to comment,  but I have. Never forgotten the amazing treatment and stay. You could stay somewhere newer, but no place as pretty and being treated like family.

data.title: A Different B&B
data.text: This was certainly an unusual B&B stay.  We arrived somewhere between 2:00-2:30, but apparently we were not supposed to arrive until 3:00 or later.  My husband called a # noted on the door.  He was told we were to have notified the host ahead of time if we were coming early.  We apologized, but since we were driving in from another state, we hadn't known what time we'd arrive.  Our host, Sonny, arrived within a half-hour and showed us to our room which was a lovely large room with our requested king bed.  We later called and requested some drinking glasses and asked if the non-working floor lamp could be replaced.  We had also noticed an electric cord running from beside the bed and across the room to the TV.  We noted that the cord was dangerous, but Sonny said if we wanted TV, that was the cord.  We did request a towel over the cord, so we wouldn't trip.  When we left for dinner, I asked where we should park if his parking area was full.  He said, "Well, you took up 2 parking spaces when you parked."  (There were no marked spaces.)  To compound our stay, the bathroom had been patched and spot painted in several different colors, the towel bar fell off the wall, and the hardware from the missing toilet paper holder was still attached to the wall.  Breakfast, which was very nice, was spent with our host asking us about a mineral silver and why it was wonderful and then asking us if we invested in stocks and promoting some of his own investments.  The bed was never made up nor towels picked up.  However, Sonny mentioned that he hoped we would write a review for Trip Advisor and so we have.

data.title: Southern hospitality at its finest!
data.text: We have stayed at many places in Knoxville and we lived in Knoxville for 6 years.  The Maplehurst is a unique place.  It's historical and has kept it's rustic charm.  The owner will bend over backwards for you and the location can't be beat.  We were able to bring both of our dogs and we had a great time.  We will stay there again!

data.title: Great place
data.text: We enjoyed our evening at Maplehurst Inn very much.  Sonny is a very nice host and very helpful.  The Inn is a short walk to a nice bbq restaurant on the river with a great view.  Our room was cool when we arrived, which was nice since it was 90 degrees out that evening.  We enjoyed a nice home cooked breakfast made by Sonny personally and enjoyed chatting with him afterwards about some of his interests.  I would love to go back again and stay at the Maplehurst.  It is an older building with a lot of character and the personal attention paid by its host was the best!!   The price cannot be beat!

data.title: Sad to give a bad review.
data.text: Booked this B&B because it was rated #1 in Knoxville. I think that's probably because Sonny is a kind and friendly host and offers several breakfast options. However, the room did not look like the photos or description and felt like it hadn't been cleaned in many many visits - cobwebs everywhere. Bed was very old. I'm not going to share the worst part because it makes my heart sad. Fair to say... I would not recommend to friends. Maybe college kids visiting for games.

data.title: Just what we needed
data.text: I needed to go to Knoxville for an overnight, and was looking for a place to stay on a budget. There are a lot of chain low end hotels in Knoxville and I was hoping to find something with a little character. The Maplehurst Inn was great. If you are a person who can appreciate old one of a kind furniture and things from another era, the decor is perfect for you. Way more interesting than some Holiday Inn. There was a parlor to sit in downstairs, an excellent breakfast, and a great location just a few blocks from Market Square and right next to the river. It was very clean, the room was spotless--the furniture was old but all was well maintained. My mom loved it, the place has a style and you won't forget it the way one forgets these cookie cutter hotels. The proprietor even gave me a lift to the UTK a few blocks away. Very nice, I'd highly recommend. Our room came out to $88, but I'd have gladly paid a bit more than that. Really happy with the stay here.
